artist: Artist: Attributed to Paulus van Vianen
description: young man wearing skirtlike garment kneeling on a sack, kissing the hand of a standing old man with long white hair and beard; architectural elements (column and steps) at left; lightly-penciled trees at right
inscription:
Inscription and Stamp

LRC, in brown: [L. Guecchi F (or L Grecchi? F)]
markings: URC, stamped in blue, in a circle: [H U B / D U F], Lugt 3926
medium: Pen and brown ink, gray wash, over black chalk on laid paper
provenance: Hubert Georges Désiré Dupond, Lugt 3926 (1901-1981/81), Brussels. Sale, Sotheby's, London, July 4, 1994, part of no.129, as Anonymous, for £750, to Moir; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1994-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Return of the Prodigal Son
